page.title: 19MYERS GROVE RAILWAY SOCIETY.
page.content: This society is run by MR.R.M.Hallatt. It has a membership of 20 pupils.The society holds meetings at dinner times on Wednesday,Thursday and Friday.This is when work is carried out on the society's model railway layout.The society organises visits to British Rail diesel depots and works around the country.Recent visits have been to Crewe works,Eastfield diesel depot in Glasgow and to Thornaby and Gateshead diesel depots in the north-east. Cardiff Canton and Swansea Landore diesel depots have also been visited. The society also visits the South Yorkshire Railway Preservation Society Here the pupils restore old industrial steam and diesel locomotives.Also they replace ballast,sleepers and rail for the engines to run on.They also are repairing a 1949 North Eastern Guards Van,and repairing the locomotive shed.
